comments: Currently the tool we use to generate update jars and update the site.xml is not open source.  We should update it release it to eclipse.org.

Actually, we should investigate using pde build/packager to generate the update jars. The existing tool is rather fragile.  

We should also create an update site that allows developers to move between I-builds that includes all sdks, examples, the releng plugin and ftp-webdav.
also, the releng plugin will have to be included in a feature because update only supports features
Sonia fixed this last week with the build optimization.  The releng tool is in a feature.  The update jars are still on the internal site only.

Updates are now replicated here with each I build. You will have to have at least M5 to use these updates.

http://update.eclipse.org/testUpdates/

When I try the url in I20060329-0800, I get this error:

Network connection problems encountered during search.
  Unable to access "http://update.eclipse.org/testUpdates/".
    Error parsing site stream. [White spaces are required between publicId and systemId.]
    Error parsing site stream. [White spaces are required between publicId and systemId.]
Are you being redirected to an ibm fullmoon server? The updates may not have replicated there yet.

I don't think I'm redirected. At least when I open the url in a browser, I'm not.

http://update.eclipse.org/testUpdates/site.xml starts with the lines below.
It looks like the closing " of the mirrorsURL attribute is missing.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>
 <site mirrorsURL="http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/eclipse/testUpdates&format=xml > <description url="index.html>The Eclipse Update Site contains feature and plug-in versions for Eclipse project releases. </description>

	<feature url="features/org.eclipse.sdk.examples_3.1.100.v20060314.jar" patch="false" id="org.eclipse.sdk.examples" version="3.1.100.v20060314">
		<category name="I20060329-1200"/>
	</feature>

The site.xml was not replicated properly due to a rsync error.

The generated qualifiers on our features were munged due to a error in our build script which precluded updating.

This should be fixed in I20060331-1210 but I will verify.
Works fine now with I20060331-2000 (3.2M6). Closing.
